adjective.description: Having or showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion.
examples: a cunning look came into his eyes
the baby will look cunning in that pink print

noun.description: Skill in achieving one's ends by deceit.
examples: a statesman to whom cunning had come as second nature

origin: Middle English: perhaps from Old Norse kunnandi knowledge, from kunna know (related to can), or perhaps from Middle English cunne, an obsolete variant of can. The original sense was (possessing) erudition or skill and had no implication of deceit; the sense deceitfulness dates from late Middle English.
